likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the 'Delayed Transition' scenario characterized by a 2.5°C temperature increase, changes in consumer preferences can be exacerbated by a growing awareness of sustainability issues. As consumers increasingly prioritize eco-friendly products, the demand for Mac Software could rise, but the transition delays may also lead to increased competition from alternative platforms that are perceived as more sustainable, resulting in a slight increase in likelihood and a moderate increase in impact.

emerging_opportunities.description: Developing and integrating more sustainable features within macOS, such as energy-efficient resource management and support for renewable energy.

additional_challenges.description: As sustainability becomes a priority for consumers, competitors may gain traction by offering more eco-friendly software solutions, impacting Mac Software's market position.

mitigation_strategies.description: Allocate resources to enhance the sustainability of macOS and other software products, focusing on energy efficiency and reduced environmental impact.
Conduct thorough market research to understand shifts in consumer preferences towards sustainability, enabling proactive adjustments to product offerings.
Form partnerships with companies specializing in green technology to enhance the eco-friendliness of the Mac Software ecosystem.
